data.body: To fix https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11339 I had to make ugly changes because the knowledge if a document is dirty or not isn't kept in the editor model but somewhere outside. That makes it very hard to provide a consistent picture of the world. Use case 1. Enter some text in an editor window

data.title: ConfigurationRegistry handles contributed configs very poorly
data.body:
Sorry I cannot save the cpuprofile.

With the default extensions this consumes 31ms of start-up time.

Long story short, for each contributed configuration, the configuration registry ends up emitting one event, which ends up triggering N configuration change events, where N is the number of contributed configurations. IMHO they should result in a single configuration change event.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/19644053/faea83d6-99ed-11e6-85de-e803bb79a9d5.png)

data.title: Open  Multiple folders
data.body:
When I open a new folder,last folder must be close,but at some time this isn't what we want.
So,that's so fun if I can open multiple folders which arrange like project inVS.

data.title: debug repl: unhelpful intellisense
data.body:
- set breakpoint in line 1 and debug this program:

``` javascript
var x = 1;
```
- in debug repl type 'x'

Observe: proposal menu appears with item '__dirname' selected.
Pressing 'return' appends '__dirname' to 'x'.

Expectation:
- type 'x' in in editor opens proposal menu with entry 'x' selected properly.

data.title: Smart Code Snippets (Complete the feature please)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: 10.0.14393

Code Snippets as you already know are very important in terms of coding speed. Now code snippets are supported in VS Code but have a little issue. I'll try to show it with one example.

When you type `prop` in C#, then press `Tab` it will result to 
`public int PropertyName { get; set; }` and that's fantastic.

But if you type `for, if, while`, or any keyword that is both code snippet and c# known keyword, you cannot access the snippet by pressing `Tab`. Instead, you have to scroll to the snippet of that keyword in the intellisense menu, then press `Enter` to get the result.
![issue-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1765653/19642491/75c315ba-99f2-11e6-9971-b5f4f749da03.jpg)
![issue-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1765653/19642492/75c6c192-99f2-11e6-8ba1-02bff43b492f.jpg)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/customization/keybindings
2. There is no way to set binding for "Synchronize changes" (lower left corner)

Future state:
1. Use ctrl + shift + G to go to Git page
2. Write commit message
3. Use command cmd + enter to close commit message
4. Use ctrl + shift + Y to synchronize changes

data.title: Variable selection is moved after entering a code snippet

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.7.0-insider (788caba5a3ca1c2b137353f4384bb0e026db1a31)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12 (16A323)
- TypeScript Version: 2.0.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a folder with a `jsconfig.json`
2. Use a Snippet in a `.js` file

The code from the snippet is inserted but the selection to enter the variable is moved so then when waiting to long the body of the snippet overwritten by the input.

Here is a gif with problem:

![snippet error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1742426/19639999/0d05cb4c-99db-11e6-8807-3f4dbd0af62e.gif)

Here is the code of the snippet: 

```
"Print to console": {
  "prefix": "cc",
  "body": [
    "console.log('${data}');",
    "console.log(${data});",
    "$0"
  ],
"description": "Log output to console"
}
```

Here is the `jsonfig.json`

```
{
    "compilerOptions":{
        "target": "ES6",
        "module": "commonjs"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
        "build"
    ]
}
```

Side note: The snippet works fine in TypeScript.

data.title: Multiple debug sessions
data.body:
Introduces a notion of multiple sessions to the debug world. 

In order to support this we had to do a large refactoring of the debug model. Now the structure is improved and no longer so centralized. 
Due to this large restructuring in the testplan item https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14171 we also aim to test a regular one session debug scenario.
It would be great if @edumunoz and @ramya-rao-a could check C++ and Go multi threading debug scenarios respecitevly some time this week on the insiders vscode.

Fixes #13426

data.title: Intellisense/OmniSharp stops working
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  Version 1.7.0-insider
  Commit 43e46ab67f3bc70490b5e8348cde431dca036397
  Date 2016-10-24T06:19:39.417Z
  Shell 1.3.8
  Renderer 52.0.2743.82
  Node 6.5.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 with kernel 4.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any project. OmniSharp works fine for a few seconds up to a minute (different every time).

When it stops working, the "# references" labels above the methods disappear, and when I press ctrl+space anywhere, it just says "Loading..." and nothing happens. The OmniSharp log doesn't give any hints, it simply stops outputting. I'll attach the [omnisharp log](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/547281/omnisharp_log.txt) of a typical run, where I just opened the project and pressed ctrl+space until it stopped working.

I also have the same issue as #14223. May or may not be related?

data.title: Unresponsive debugger
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1 (latest)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start nodejs debugger
2. Make the code reach a breakpoint or an exception

After waiting some seconds waiting for the debugger to respond, I get a new tab of the file which stopped the execution labeled with the absolute path to the file. In the editor the content of the file is not displayed, instead it shows: _Could not retrieve content_ . The call stack and variables seem to be correct, I am just not able to see the file content and debug properly.

There is no error in the developer console, and I am having this error since I updated to 1.6.1

data.title: Unable to invoke "Disable" action with keyboard
data.body: I would assume Space and/or Enter to trigger the action.

data.title: ctrl+k, ctrl+d does not format code as indicated
data.body:
I am looking at Default keyword shortcuts and can see two entries:

```
{ "key": "ctrl+k ctrl+d",        
 "command": "editor.action.formatDocument",
 "when": "editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly" },
{ "key": "shift+alt+f",         
  "command": "editor.action.formatDocument",
  "when": "editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly" },
```

Yet the first shortcut never seems to work, i tried overriding with shift+alt+ set to empty command, but that doesn't work, what do I do to make it work?
